content.question: Which of the following equations best represents the chemical changes that occur during ocean acidification?

choices.label: <math alttext="C O 2 plus C a with a positive 1 charge, plus C O 3 with a negative 2 charge, react to produce C a C O 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Ca</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>CaCO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="6 C O 2 plus 6 H 2 O react to produce C 6 H 12 O 2 plus 6 O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>6CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>6H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle><mtext> </mtext><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>6O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="C O 2 plus H 2 O react to produce 2 H with a positive 1 charge, plus C O 3 with a negative 2 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mtext>O</mtext></mstyle><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mn>2</mn><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="C H 4 plus 2 O 2 react to produce C O 2 plus 2 H 2 O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>2O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>2H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="C O 2 plus H 2 O react to produce 2 H with a positive 1 charge, plus C O 3 with a negative 2 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mtext>O</mtext></mstyle><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mn>2</mn><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Explain environmental concepts, processes, or models in applied contexts.
